verses.roman:
nirantara nāsāya paśe kṛṣṇa-parimala
gandha āsvādite prabhu ha-ilā pāgala

synonyms: nirantara—incessantly; nāsāya—in the nostrils; paśe—enters; kṛṣṇa-parimala—the scent of Kṛṣṇa's body; gandha āsvādite—to relish the fragrance; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; ha-ilā pāgala—became mad.
translation: The scent of Kṛṣṇa's body, however, incessantly entered His nostrils, and the Lord became mad to relish it.
